thread.title: Mount Everett needs four sets to beat Lenox in volleyball
thread.title_full: Mount Everett needs four sets to beat Lenox in volleyball

author:
Berkshire Eagle Staff
sports@berkshireeagle.com @EagleSportsZone on Twitter
title: Mount Everett needs four sets to beat Lenox in volleyball
text:
Mount Everett needs four sets to beat Lenox in volleyball Eagles win opening set 33-31; Lenox boys beat Gateway in soccer 
Berkshire Eagle Staff Posted: 10/09/2015 11:42:40 PM EDT Updated: 10/09/2015 11:42:41 PM EDT 
SHEFFIELD >> It was like the first set would never end. 
Mount Everett won a first set that had 64 points in it, and went on to defeat Lenox in four sets. The scores were 33-31, 25-20, 23-25, 25-22. With the win, the Eagles improve to 8-4 and 6-0 in the South. A win Tuesday at Taconic would give the Eagles the South crown. 
"There was no quit in them tonight. That first set was unbelievable," said Everett coach Dennis Sullivan. "All four sets were like that. It was a great match. Both teams played their hearts out." 
For the Eagles, Kayla Krom led the way with 19 kills, five blocks and an ace. Jess Abbot had eight kills, two aces and two blocks while Chandler DeGrenier had 15 assists and six aces. 
Morgan Levesque registered 35 assists for the Millionaires, along with four kills and three digs. Morgan Hayden had 18 digs and eight kills, while Kasey Balley had 18 kills, 13 digs and seven aces. 
WAHCONAH 3, PITTSFIELD 2 
In Pittsfield, the host Generals rallied back from a two-set deficit to force a deciding fifth set. But the Warriors came away with a 25-18, 25-21, 23-25, 18-25, 15-7 victory. 
"It would have been nice to win this one tonight," said Pittsfield coach Brian Lawton. "We play them again Tuesday. We'll get another shot at it." 
For Wahconah, Sara LaFreniere had 21 kills and six blocks. Lawton described many of her kills as powerful. Hailey Parker had 34 assists and six aces for the Warriors and Audrey Pierce had 14 blocks and seven kills. Advertisement 
For Pittsfield, Riley Nichols had 24 assists and seven digs. Dominique Trottier chipped in with seven kllls and four blocks while Michaela LaBlanc had six kills, seven aces and six digs. Boys soccer 
LENOX 5, GATEWAY 0 
The Millionaires (7-3-1) faced their first Division IV opponent and sent the visiting Gators home on the short end of a shutout. 
"This was our first D-IV game. We want to make a statement," said Lenox coach Dave Pugh. "We treated it like a tournament game. Our guys came out very focused." 
It took Lenox only nine minutes to get on the board as Matt Heim converted what Pugh called a "beautiful cross" from Nic Baruch for the first goal. That turned out to be the only goal the Millionaires needed. 
Matt Tibbetts had to make only one save to get the shutout as Lenox won its fifth game in its last six. 
———
